ai.summary: A scenic 10.7 km out-and-back hike from Mytholmroyd to the summit of Stoodley Pike. The route offers a moderate ascent via well-defined footpaths and tracks, with rewarding panoramic views over the Calder Valley and surrounding countryside. Suitable for hikers with moderate fitness seeking a rewarding hilltop viewpoint.
ai.terrain_summary: The ascent follows a mix of public footpaths, stone tracks, and grassy inclines. Expect uneven surfaces, occasional muddy stretches, loose stones, and short steep sections as you climb toward Stoodley Pike. At the summit, conditions can be exposed and windy, with panoramic but potentially breezy views.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather forecast before you go; UK conditions can change quickly. Wear sturdy, waterproof boots and dress in layers. Bring a map or GPS, a fully charged phone, and a basic first aid kit. Stay on marked paths, watch for muddy and slippery sections, and be prepared for exposed winds at the top. Let someone know your plan and expected return time. Carry water and snacks, and have a light source if you might return after dark.
recommended_gear: Map and/or GPS device or a charged smartphone with offline maps
Lightweight headlamp or torch (for late returns)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) typically offers the best conditions and clearer views; winter can be muddy with potential ice and wind, so plan accordingly.
